clinical_study.official_title: Dichloroacetate Treatment of Congenital Lactic Acidosis Phase B: Open Label

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical trial to evaluate the safety of Dichloroacetate in children and adults with congenital lactic acidosis.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective is to continue evaluating the chronic safety of dichloroacetate (DCA) as a potential treatment for patients with certain heretofore untreatable forms of congenital lactic acidosis. Adverse events will be used to evaluate this outcome.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Efficacy of Dichloroacetate in Patients with Congenital Lactic Acidosis
primary_outcome.description: Determine the chronic safety of oral DCA in patients with CLA, as assessed by periodic clinical biochemical and nerve conduction evaluations.

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary objective is to determine the genotype of the subjects. It has been determined that genotype affects the metabolism of dichloroacetate. There are slow metabolizers and fast metabolizers. It is important to know a person's genotype for dosing purposes. Patients will have genotypes done.

arm_group.description: Patients are given the drug Dichloroacetate at a dose of 25mg/kg divided in two equal doses each day. They will take this drug for an indefinite period of time.

intervention.description: Subjects are given DCA 25mg/kg in a divided dose twice a day. They have EEG's done and nerve conduction studies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of congenital lactic acidosis including pyruvate dehydrogenase complex,
- Complexes 1-4, and
- Melas
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intolerance to DCA
